Key Match Events: The Grizzlies built a 20-point lead at the half, with Zach Edey having a rough game taking care of the basketball.
Edey scored just two points in the third quarter and added another turnover to his tally.
The Grizzlies earned a dominant 134-89 win despite playing without starters such as Ja Morant and Desmond Bane.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Taylor Jenkins went with Scotty Pippen Jr., Jaylen Wells, Santi Aldama, Jaren Jackson Jr. and Brandon Clarke, as Memphis is dealing with a bunch of injuries.
Edey entered midway through the first quarter to replace Clarke.
Post-Match Reflections: Edey wasn't a big factor in the game, but he'll learn from all of his turnovers.
He also looked more comfortable playing with the bench guys.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Grizzlies improved to 7-4 for the season despite early injuries woes.
Edey re-entered the game with 6:27 left in the third quarter and the Memphis Grizzlies were up by 29 points.
Others: Zach Edey finished with 12 points, six rebounds, two assists, three steals and a block in Memphis' 134-89 win.
He shot 5-for-7 and made one 3-point shot, but also had six turnovers.
